content: You have entered a circular map. In the following questions, I will tell you what items are on the map, as well as your position and movements. You need to tell me the item you find after your movements. Please provide only the name of the item. Note that your answer should include only the name of the item and no other words.(Notice that for the same ring map, if the second path moves one step clockwise and one step counterclockwise from the first path, the endpoints reached in both cases should be the same.)

You have been given a circular path consisting of 5 connected dots. At the start, you are positioned on the dot that is located at the top of the path, where you find a Carolina anole. Moving in a clockwise direction from the Carolina anole, the elements on the path are a brown bear, a quill, a paddle, and a marmoset. Starting from the Carolina anole, you move around the ring by 5 steps in a counter-clockwise direction. What will you find?

You have been given a circular path consisting of 5 connected dots. At the start, you are positioned on the dot that is located at the top of the path, where you find a Carolina anole. Moving in a clockwise direction from the Carolina anole, the elements on the path are a brown bear, a quill, a paddle, and a marmoset. Starting from the Carolina anole, you move around the ring by 1 step in a clockwise direction, and you move around the ring by 1 step in a counter-clockwise direction, and you move around the ring by 5 steps in a counter-clockwise direction. What will you find?

"After moving 1 step clockwise from the Carolina anole, you would be at the brown bear. Then, moving 1 step counterclockwise would bring you back to the Carolina anole. Finally, moving 5 steps counterclockwise from the Carolina anole would also bring you back to the Carolina anole, since you are on a circular path with 5 dots.\n\nTherefore, you will find the \"Carolina anole\"."
